subclassFeature.name: The Fallen
entries: Your patron was once a resident of the upper planes, though they are no longer. Cast out by their kin, they have departed from their celestial origins and dabbled in darker magics. Though fallen angels are the most well known patrons of this type, there are many celestials capable of falling from grace. Some warlocks bind themselves with a fallen Empyrean, ki-rin, unicorn, couatl, or other such creature, but fallen angels are by far the most common.

Through your connection with your patron, you gain both holy and unholy powers. It is common for warlocks of the Fallen to be mistaken for Celestial warlocks, as they tend to wield the powers of the divine more often than not. But as combat drags on and a Fallen warlock becomes more desperate, their mind and body transfonn as they unlock their darker powers. Your hair, skin, and eyes might change color, and your personality might change as well, perhaps even drastically. Even an altruistic idealist could become a merciless killer.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Fallen lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the Warlock list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Angelic Duality
entries: At 1st level, your patron gives you two distinct sets of powers: one derived from their celestial heritage, and the other from their evil nature. You gain the following powers:

entries.name: Risen
entries: While you have more than or equal to half your hit points left, you gain the powers of the risen. When a friendly creature within 30 feet of you is reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to give it advantage on its next death saving throw and release a blinding light from its body. Each creature of your choice within 10 feet of your fallen ally must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or be blinded until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Fallen
entries: While you have less than half your hit points left, you gain the powers of the fallen. When a hostile creature within 30 feet of you is reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to release a menacing aura from its body. Each creature of your choice within 10 feet of the fallen enemy must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or take 1d4 + half your Warlock level in psychic damage and be frightened of you until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Rise and Fall
entries: Using your bonus action, choose a number no greater than half your hit point maximum. You take necrotic damage equal to the chosen amount, which cannot be reduced through any means, and you store a number of hit points equal to the same amount. As a bonus action, you can consume the stored hit points, allowing you to regain a number of hit points equal to the amount stored. If you still have stored hit points at the end of a short or long rest, those hit points are lost.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Of The Fallen
entries: Starting at 6th level, your link to the Fallen makes you resilient to certain damage types. While you are Risen, you have resistance to radiant damage. While you are Fallen, you have resistance to necrotic damage.

Also, when you take damage from a creature within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to magically rebuke them. That creature takes damage equal to your Charisma modifier + your warlock level. The damage type is radiant if you are Risen, and necrotic if you are Fallen. Once you rebuke a creature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Angelic Form
entries: At 10th level, your body changes as you rise and fall. You gain one of the following features, dependent on whether you are Risen or Fallen:

entries.name: Risen
entries: You gain large, angelic wings that grant you a flying speed equal to your walking speed. If you lose these wings by falling below half health, you gain the effects of {@spell featherfall} until you touch the ground.

entries.name: Fallen
entries: Your skin becomes unnaturally tough. If your AC isn't already higher, it becomes 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier. Additional bonuses cannot be added to this AC calculation.

subclassFeature.name: Gift of the Divine
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you can perform great displays of divine power. As an action, you release bolts of energy from your body with different effects based on whether you are Risen or Fallen:

entries.name: Risen
entries: You evoke healing energy that can restore 10d10 hit points. Choose any number of creatures within 30 feet of you. You divide these hit points among them.

entries.name: Fallen
entries: You evoke deathly energy that can deal 10d10 necrotic damage. Choose any munber of creatures within 30 feet of you. You divide this damage among them.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
